title: Tamagawa number
summary: In mathematics, the Tamagawa number τ ( G ) {\displaystyle \tau (G)} of a semisimple algebraic group defined over a global field k is the measure of G ( A ) / G ( k ) {\displaystyle G(\mathbb {A} )/G(k)} , where A {\displaystyle \mathbb {A} } is the adele ring of k. Tamagawa numbers were introduced by Tamagawa (1966), and named after him by Weil (1959).
